\sphinxAtStartPar
Data Class for a generic day of a behavioral task
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Required Inputs}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{Meta} : Passed meta from experimental hierarchy (directory, mouse\_id)
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{Stage} : Title of Stage
\end{DUlineblock}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Properties}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{mouse\_id} : Identifies which mouse this data belongs to
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{instance\_data} : Identifies when this behavioral stage was created
\end{DUlineblock}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Attributes}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{data} : Pandas dataframe of synced data
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{folder\_dictionary} : A dictionary of relevant folders for this behavioral stage
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{modifications} : List of modifications made to this behavioral stage
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{meta} : bruker metadata
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{multi\_index}: Pandas multi\sphinxhyphen{}index of behavioral components
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{state\_index} : look\sphinxhyphen{}up table / index relating states to integers
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{trial\_parameters} : behavioral parameters
\end{DUlineblock}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Methods}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{add\_image\_sampling\_folder} : Generates a folder for containing imaging data of a specific sampling rate
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_data} : Loads all data
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{record\_mod} :  Records a modification made to the behavioral stage (Date \& Time)
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{update\_folder\_dictionary} : This function reindexes all folders in the folder dictionary
\end{DUlineblock}

\end{description}

\index{clean\_up\_compilation() (ExperimentHierarchy.CollectedImagingAnalysisFolder method)@\spxentry{clean\_up\_compilation()}\spxextra{ExperimentHierarchy.CollectedImagingAnalysisFolder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ExperimentHierarchy:ExperimentHierarchy.CollectedImagingAnalysisFolder.clean_up_compilation}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{clean\_up\_compilation}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ Self}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

This function generates a video (i.e., numpy array {[}Z x Y x X{]})
in which the ROIs or subsets of ROIs utilize a different colormap
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Keyword Arguments}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{cmap} : Colormap to use on ROIs (str, default None)
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{colors} : colors which will be used to generate custom colormap
\item[] (tuple{[}tuple{[}float{]}{]}, default None)
\item[] Example \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} ((0, 0, 0), (0.074, 0.624, 1.000), (0.074, 0.624, 1.000))
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{background} : boolean indicating whether to overlay on a blank image
\item[] or the background of input image (bool , default True)
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{white\_background} : boolean indicating whether to use a white or black background
\item[] (bool, default False)
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{write} : boolean indicating whether to write video to file
\item[] (bool, default False)
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{filename} : file path for saving video (str, default None)
\end{DUlineblock}

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{IO.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{repackage\_bruker\_tiffs}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ImageDirectory}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{OutputDirectory}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Union\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{,}\DUrole{w}{  }tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Repackages a sequence of tiff files within a directory to a smaller sequence
of tiff stacks.
Designed to compile the outputs of a certain imaging utility
that exports recordings such that each frame is saved as a single tiff.
:param ImageDirectory: Directory containing a sequence of single frame tiff files
:type ImageDirectory: str
:param OutputDirectory: Empty directory where tiff stacks will be saved
:type OutputDirectory: str
:param args: optional argument to indicate the repackaging of a specific channel and/or plane
:type args: int
:rtype: None

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ImageProcessing:ImageProcessing.blockwise_fast_filter_tiff}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ImageProcessing.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{blockwise\_fast\_filter\_tiff}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{Images}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{ndarray}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{Footprint}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}ndarray\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ ndarray}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
GPU\sphinxhyphen{}parallelized multidimensional median filter performed in overlapping blocks.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Designed for use on arrays larger than the available memory capacity.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Footprint is of the form np.ones((Z pixels, Y pixels, X pixels)) with the origin in the center

\sphinxAtStartPar
Requires CuPy
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Footprint}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Any}}) \textendash{} Mask of the median filter (Optional, Default 3 x 3 x 3)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{block\_size}} \textendash{} Integer indicating the size of each block. Must fit within memory. (int, default 21000)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{block\_buffer\_region}} \textendash{} Integer indicating the size of the overlapping region between blocks (int, default 500)

\end{itemize}
